translated: “Is there knowledge of the fruit in a disciple?”
“Does a disciple proclaim the fruit that has been made?”
“Is there knowledge of the fruit in a disciple?”

analyzed: atthi sāvakassa phala paropariyatti indriya paropariyatti puggala paropariyatti iti
translated: “Are there in a disciple the higher and lower of the fruit, the higher and lower of the faculties, and the higher and lower of the individuals?”
“Is there knowledge of the fruit in a disciple?”

original: Atthi sāvakassa khandhapaññatti āyatanapaññatti dhātupaññatti saccapaññatti indriyapaññatti puggalapaññattīti?
analyzed: atthi sāvakassa khandha paññatti āyatana paññatti dhātu paññatti sacca paññatti indriya paññatti puggala paññatti iti
translated: “Are there in a disciple the determinations of the aggregates, the determinations of the sense bases, the determinations of the elements, the determinations of the truths, the determinations of the faculties, and the determinations of the individuals?”
“Is there knowledge of the fruit in a disciple?”

original: Sāvako jino satthā sammāsambuddho sabbaññū sabbadassāvī dhammassāmī dhammappaṭisaraṇoti?
analyzed: sāvakaḥ jinaḥ satthā sammāsambuddhaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī dhamma ssāmī dhamma ppaṭisaraṇaḥ ti
translated: “Is a disciple a victor, a teacher, a fully enlightened one, all-seeing, all-knowing, a lord of the Dhamma, a protector of the Dhamma?”
“Is there knowledge of the fruit in a disciple?”

original: Sāvako anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā asañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā anakkhātassa maggassa akkhātā maggaññū maggavidū maggakovidoti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Na vattabbaṁ—🔽“sāvakassa phale ñāṇaṁ atthī”ti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Sāvako aññāṇīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽tena hi sāvakassa phale ñāṇaṁ atthīti …pe….🔽Phalañāṇakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Pañcamo vaggo.🔽Tassuddānaṁ🔽Vimuttiñāṇaṁ vimuttaṁ, sekhassa asekhaṁ ñāṇaṁ, viparīte ñāṇaṁ, aniyatassa niyāmagamanāya🔽atthi ñāṇaṁ, sabbaṁ ñāṇaṁ paṭisambhidāti, sammutiñāṇaṁ, cetopariyāye ñāṇaṁ, anāgate
analyzed: sāvakaḥ anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā a sañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā an akkhātassa maggassa akkhātā maggaññū magga vidū magga kovidaḥ ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  na vattabba  sāvakassa phale ñāṇam atthi iti  āmantā  sāvakaḥ aññāṇi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  tena hi sāvakassa phale ñāṇam atthi iti pe  phala ñāṇa kathā niṭṭhitā  pañcamaḥ vaggo  tassa uddāna  vimutti ñāṇam vimutta sekhassa asekham ñāṇa viparīte ñāṇa aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya  atthi ñāṇa sabbam ñāṇam paṭisambhidā ati sammuti ñāṇa cetas pariyāye ñāṇa anāgate
translated: Is a disciple one who gives rise to the unarisen path, one who generates the ungenerated path, one who makes known the unknown path, one who is a knower of the path, one who has seen the path, one who has attained the path, one who has fully understood the path?”🔽“That can’t be said.”🔽“It follows then that🔽‘a disciple has knowledge of the fruit’?🔽“I deny that.”🔽“Is a disciple one who knows?”🔽“That can’t be said.”🔽“Then it is not the case that🔽‘a disciple has knowledge of the fruit.’“🔽The Discussion of Knowledge of the Fruits is finished.🔽The fifth section is finished.🔽The summary:🔽Liberation-knowledge, liberated, the knowledge of the one in training, the knowledge of the one beyond training, the knowledge of the opposite, the knowledge of the undetermined going to a destination,🔽the knowledge that there is, all knowledge, the analytical knowledges, conventional knowledge, knowledge of the thoughts of others, in the future,

original: ñāṇaṁ, paṭuppanne ñāṇaṁ, sāvakassa phale ñāṇanti.🔽Mahāpaṇṇāsako.🔽Tassāpi uddānaṁ🔽Sattupaladdhiṁ, upaharato, balaṁ, gihi’ssa arahā ca, vimuttipañcamanti.
analyzed: ñāṇa paṭuppanne ñāṇa sāvakassa phale ñāṇanti 🔽mahāpaṇṇāsako 🔽tassa api uddāna 🔽upaharataḥ arahā ca
